availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis M. Ray (Hickman County, KY, attorney)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, school teacher and attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Martha F. Ray. Father of Mary F. Ray, Ada J. Ray, and Robert M. Ray. School teacher in Henderson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Henderson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Attorney in Hickman County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Hickman County from 1863 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the Untied States(1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Henderson County, District 3, p. 127B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the Untied States(1850), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Henderson County, District 3.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Clinton, p. 498.
Eight Manuscript Census of the United States(1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Clinton, p. 208A.
